spans.text: Taki, holding two parfaits, found an empty spot near the snack stalls and sat down.
Raana, saying "Let's dig in," immediately scooped a large chunk into her mouth. After a few years, she's learned some table manners, but not much.
(This girl, she's still the same as ever...)
(But... why did she ask that kind of question when she was at home?)
(Although I glossed over it then, and she didn't pursue it, but...)
Taki observed Raana enjoying her parfait, her innocent appearance no different from usual.
(Did something happen?)
Taki remembered Raana's sudden visit one night a while ago.
She certainly felt some kind of sense of incongruity at the time.
Appearing out of nowhere, leaving out of nowhere, very Raana-like, but also different somehow.
Taki recalled the joint practice session some time ago, when Raana was so tired that she fell asleep standing up, and then left without saying goodbye.
And today, she came looking for her out of the blue.
In the morning, she even said she had come to find her before? When asked what she wanted, she wouldn't answer.
It's very Raana-like, but it always feels like something is different.
...Raana.
As the words came out of her mouth, Taki realized that she hadn't thought about how to ask.
Uh... about that signature you asked about last time, do you really not need it? If it was something you promised a classmate, it's better to fulfill it.
That classmate isn't at school anymore.
Huh? What do you mean?
Work.
Found a job, joined a new band, so they don't come to school anymore.
I see.
Yeah, most seniors who are about to graduate are usually doing internships or working off-campus.
Most?
Is that how everyone is?
Well, from a general social perspective, yes.
Speaking of which, how's school been lately? It must be busy with graduation coming up.
Tomori said she was helping you revise your thesis.
Uh... how's school been lately? It must be busy with graduation coming up.
Tomori said she was helping you revise your thesis.
The word count wasn't enough, so the teacher sent it back.
I knew it...
How dare you hand in a paper that was less than two pages long last year?
Because, that's all I wanted to write.
That's not right, you wrote this year's paper with Tomori, right? Still not enough words?
Yeah. Tomori said she's not good at writing argumentative essays like that.
Also, the final assignment for the composition class hasn't passed yet either.
Not enough credits.
Huh!?

Although it's true that you didn't have enough credits to postpone graduation last year because you skipped too many classes... but with your skills, you wouldn't fail if you did your homework properly.

Seriously, if you have a problem, say it earlier, graduation is in two months, what are you going to do if you postpone it again!! I can help you compose some of the rhythm, just these two days... but you have to write the melody yourself!
...Is that not allowed?
What do you mean?
Is postponing graduation not allowed?
Huh? If you don't graduate, you won't get a degree, you won't be able to—
—Can't find a job.
Taki almost blurted out.
But she suddenly realized that the above general social common sense does not work on this extraordinary talent in front of her.

Besides, anyone who knows Raana would find it hard to imagine her doing anything other than music, right? As long as her playing skills are excellent, a degree is just a piece of paper. The number of rock stars on this planet who have received higher education is very few.
Speaking of which, everyone was a little surprised when Raana said she was going to apply to music school back then.
Someone like Raana, who plays the guitar with talent and instinct, would actually enter an authoritative institution representing some kind of discipline to receive further education.
However, being surrounded by music all the time must be a happy thing for Raana, so everyone was just happy for her.
But in the past two years, Taki has been so busy with her own affairs and the band that she seems to have rarely asked about Raana's recent situation.

Is school fun? Are you still adapting? What kind of classes are you taking at music school? This kind of parental care is not yet Taki's turn, and Raana is already an adult, she will take care of herself.

Postponing graduation—is very in line with the impression of Raana. Free and undisciplined, doing whatever she wants, not attending classes properly, the word count of the thesis is not up to standard, in no way is she like a qualified student.
She didn't notice it in the first year, but this year everyone will lend a hand and it won't be difficult to pass this hurdle.
But—what about after that?
Taki seemed to have noticed something.
Why is Raana so indifferent to graduation, why does Raana always come to her, but can't say anything.
Maybe Raana is facing some kind of problem similar to her own.
...It's not like you can't, anyway, you've been studying for 4, no, 5 years, wouldn't all the previous efforts be wasted if you didn't graduate?
You also want to quickly stop writing papers, stop doing homework, and do more things you want to do, right?
Taki then noticed that the person in front of her had long stopped scooping up the dessert.
I want to play the guitar, but I can play the guitar anytime.
At home, at school, in MyGO.
In…
——Little Raana, Little Raana!!
I got the offer!!
It's ■■■'s band project! And we might be able to debut next year!!
Congratulations.
Hahaha, thank you~!
I can finally embark on a professional path... maybe I can meet my idol backstage... oh my god, oh my god, I have to practice twice as hard from today!!
But I have to go to the company for training in two weeks, and I probably won't have time to go back to school except for the graduation ceremony, sob sob.
Corporate slave?
Hahahaha!! Kind of!
Speaking of which, what offer did Little Raana get? You're so skilled, I'm sure a lot of bands are clamoring for you!
I have a band.
Ah, are you talking about that Live House band you're in now? I went to see you before, and I really like that drummer, can you get me an autograph sometime~~
Autograph?
Got it.
But I remember that you guys haven't debuted yet, and it seems like you haven't been doing much lately, do you have a contract? Do you get paid?
Debut?
Oh dear, Little Raana, why don't you know anything? We're all about to graduate, we can't be like kids and not think about anything! You've already postponed graduation for a year!
You also need to plan for your future! With your talent, you can't always be buried in an amateur band that doesn't debut!
Or I can ask for an internal referral when I join the company, it would be nice to work with Little Raana...
You………
(Raana... is also confused?)
This kind of confusion is not uncommon for any young person about to enter society.
But Taki had never imagined that these things would also happen to Raana.
A carefree, free-spirited wild cat, because she has a home, has become afraid of freedom.
(But... what good advice can I give when I'm also in the midst of confusion.)
Raa—
Thanks for the treat.

Raana pushed the half-eaten matcha parfait to the person next to her, the cream and matcha melted stickily at the bottom of the cup, and there were still traces on the walls of the cup, which looked terrible.
Huh, you're not going to eat anymore?
Like we agreed, 1.5.
Raana really didn't mean to continue eating.
...Sigh, don't waste food.
Taki took the parfait and reached for the spoon in Raana's hand, their fingertips touching, sticky.
Is it good?
Hmm... it's okay, but it's too greasy now.
Hoo hoo~
Raana looked very satisfied.
(What is she smiling about again... this girl is really incomprehensible...)
Rikki, do you have anything else to do?
Nothing, what's wrong?
Come with me.

Although she is a college student who is overwhelmed with thesis work but still makes time to run around, she grabbed the sleeve of the working adult without explanation at this moment, and showed the other party her youthful strength.
Slow...slow down Raana! Hey, where are you taking me?
You'll know when we get there.
How did even you learn to keep things a secret...
Heh heh~~~
